column4: I have 2 of these drives that are both giving me the same error, and both ran beautifully on Ubuntu until they hiccupped and started giving me errors, I am running Ubuntu 10.10 and do NOT have windows on any maching
machine dammit

Is This it?  Recover Deleted Files on an NTFS Hard Drive from a Ubuntu Live CD - How-To Geek
i never really looked at your pastebin of the error message and you never summariuzed it.. so i dont know what your original issue is.
the win vista/7 recovery disk links there - let you get a windows 'rescue' type dvd you can boot and do various fs checks and other fix's.

What is happening is that it tells me that it cannot be mounted and there are trashed files  It is telling me to do a fdisk /f and then reboot 2 times and I saw that  but not knowing 7 at all I wasn't sure
headed back there now
then you need to use a friends windows pc., or one of those dvd's to filesystem check the hd's
Thanks for your help, and time....  I have your page bookmarked now...
ddrescue the drives to a image file, and try to recover from the image file. is what i did the other day for a failing 1 TB hd.
if you are lucky ddrescue will recover them.. and/or photorec..  it took me a week to recovery my 1tb.. but i got like 99% of the files from it.
try installing somthing simple from the repos like 'unp' or 'pastebinit' see if that works.. sudo apt-get install pastebinit
I sent you the last paste errors when I tried to do an upgrade using the upgrade manager and it runs and runs and then just fails and plays dead?????
id stick to the cli tools . better error messages. and  it looks like server either had some currupted files . or the connection is flakey. try switching mirroes.
